file_content.text: Republic troops are in Gorma-Koss, and Voss commandos are boarding our ships. I knew I could count on you.
I'm not giving up on the Voss. When they make peace with the Gormak, the Republic's going to be there.
We've got the Voss's attention. Now we show them what the Republic is all about.
A vision of the Republic helping the Voss... what incredible luck. Let's see where they want you to start.
Laryn-Ki's aware you completed the Mystics' trials in the Shrine of Healing. I'm impressed.
He's told the Voss commandos to consider you an ally. They're already on the front lines in Gorma-Koss, the Gormak kingdom.
Why are the Voss and the Gormak at war?
What's the situation?
I understand the Gormak started it. They believe the Mystics are an abomination.
Understood.
Do they expect me to take on the whole Gormak army?
I can't fight a war!
Of course not. I think.
Once you've made it to Gorma-Koss, find Edan-Je, one of the Voss commandos. He'll be waiting for you.
This is the Republic's chance to prove ourselves to the Voss. Do us proud.
Laryn-Ki is bound by the Mystics' vision, but he wants to be sure you're prepared.
He's asking that you complete the Mystics' trials at the Shrine of Healing, something no ordinary Voss has ever survived.
I'm no Mystic, but I'll find a way.
Don't worry, I'll make it.
What are these trials?
That's all I know. The trials are part of the Mystics' training. No outsider has ever attempted them.
Great. So I'm toast.
It's a test. They don't expect you to finish, but you'll show them, right?
You'll need to make the pilgrimage to the Shrine of Healing. The guide, Suva-Rak, leads a pilgrim camp near the local transport.
You make it through these trials, and the Voss will be more than impressed. I'm counting on you.
Master Delsa, I had no contact with the failed Mystics. The Republic had nothing to do with this.
Yet the Voss claim your agents promised them a home in the order. Shall I ask them?
Any Mystic, even a failed one, is raw, dangerous power. How could you offer them Jedi training?
Would you rather see them as Sith?
I had no other choice.
That is never the only alternative.
The Jedi can teach the Voss to use their power.
We should face our fears.
And when they turn against us? Or hadn't you thought that far ahead...?
They need training, and I trust the Jedi to do it.
Because you're the best.
The ability to do something doesn't erase the danger of doing it.
Those kids had enough people telling them no.
It was the right thing to do.
At the first sign of rejection, they joined the Sith. Like you, they have no patience.
They'll be model students.
The Voss have no concept of the dark side or its dangers. Neither do you, it appears.
Why are you so upset?
If you cannot understand, you are in need of further training.
You have no idea of the dangers we protect you from.
I've said my piece. Ambassador Jannik tells me Laryn-Ki is on his way. I'll leave you to your diplomacy.
I have to admit, when I wished I could force the Jedi to accept the Mystics, I didn't think you'd actually do it.
Will the Voss be upset?
Is that a problem?
Lord Beldiss lured the Voss in. They approached the Jedi on their own, and it saved their lives.
It was this or the Sith.
That's why the order took them in--better Mystic Jedi than Mystic Sith.
I'm not afraid of them.
You don't have to deal with the fallout. I didn't think relations between the order and the Republic could get any worse.
No matter how the Jedi feel, the Republic needs this alliance, and you brought us one step closer. Remember that.
The lost potentials confirmed Lord Beldiss's crimes. I have not come to discuss it.
Your days on Voss are numbered, Ambassador. Lord Beldiss conducted some harmless recruitment. The Republic's done murder.
Those Voss attacked because of their Sith training. We responded in self-defense.
When Laryn-Ki arrives, explain that to him. I'm sure he'll be very sympathetic.
I can't wait to hear you defend turning failed Mystics into Sith.
I have nothing to hide.
You assume I plan to defend it.
Laryn-Ki will see through the Sith's lies.
Don't try to spin this.
You killed Voss civilians. That requires little embellishment.
Lord Beldiss started this. Laryn-Ki will thank the Republic for ending it.
More towards us than you.
Ambassador Jannik certainly hopes so, doesn't he?
Cry all you want. We caught the Empire red-handed.
What a sore loser.
Voss blood is on your hands, not mine.
How many Sith diplomats does the Empire have?
Not another one.
Darth Serevin has assumed Lord Beldiss's responsibilities. That includes making false accusations against the Republic.
Threats won't help you.
You are a fool to believe defeating Lord Beldiss means you can defeat me.
The failed Mystics were lured in by the Sith, and they met a Sith's end. I just hope the Voss understand.
Laryn-Ki. I apologize for this tragedy. The Republic was only trying to stop Lord Beldiss.
The lost potentials acted against fate. You are not to blame.
Lord Beldiss's actions were not sanctioned by the Empire. Had you approached us, the Voss would have returned safely.
Lord Beldiss ordered the Voss to attack me.
I had to defend myself.
Lord Beldiss is dead. The Empire's crimes die with him.
I wanted to save them.
They were not meant to be Sith.
What a load of bunk.
This is the second rogue Imperial attack. Choose your leaders more carefully.
The Empire appreciates your understanding. It will not happen again.
I have not come to choose sides. There are greater threats on Voss.
The Mystics have a vision. An outsider will end the threat of the Gormak. We believe it is you.
I'm honored, but there's a lot of outsiders here.
Me? Why me?
You protected the lost potentials. Our interpreters considered this.
You sacrificed Voss to protect Voss. You will do what is necessary.
Who or what are the Gormak?
The Gormak?
Savages. They turn the wild into machines, beasts into weapons. They must be stopped.
I sure don't.
The Mystics are never wrong.
The Mystics see, the Three decide, the Voss act. You are not Voss. Will you follow this vision?
I'll do whatever's needed to help defeat the Gormak.
I would be honored.
Much may be required.
If the Mystics saw it, my answer doesn't matter.
You know that I will.
You understand.
The Republic always supports its allies.
That's what we do.
The Mystics saw you, not the Republic.
I always wanted to be part of a prophecy.
Sounds like fun.
A happy coincidence.
If I get time.
You will defeat the Gormak. The Mystics have seen it.
Ambassador Jannik has your instructions. Farewell.
Lord Beldiss is corrupting the Voss. We just need to catch him.
Lord Beldiss has found the Voss's weak spot. He converts enough failed Mystics, and the Empire won't need an alliance.
I'd offer an alternative, but the Jedi see the Mystics as a threat.
Lord Beldiss is the enemy here.
The Jedi aren't the problem.
You're right--our focus should be on saving the failed Mystics. Maybe the experience will change some minds.
Being cautious about the Mystics isn't a crime.
A question mark, not a threat.
If it ruins the Republic's chances at an alliance, it should be.
The Republic can't rely on the Jedi for everything.
We don't need their help.
The Republic is going to make this alliance happen, with or without the order.
The Jedi need to loosen their robes and live a little.
Everything's a threat to them.
Keep that to yourself. Relations with the order are strained enough.
Have the Mystics shown any interest in the Jedi?
Would it make a difference?
They might if it was an option. But we have to save them first.
It's out of your hands then.
Probably for the best. The order would be furious if they were forced to welcome the failed Mystics.
When Terrax finds a failed Mystic, he sends them to the Ruined City, the remains of an ancient Voss settlement.
The Sith have a training camp there. If we catch them with the failed Mystics, the Voss will have to take notice.
I'll show the failed Mystics what Lord Beldiss really wants.
I'll expose the Sith's ways.
It might be a hard sell. The Voss are devoted to their beliefs.
The Voss may not be willing to leave their new Sith life.
What if we're too late?
We'll deal with that if it arises.
How do we keep the Voss out of the cross fire?
This fight could get ugly.
It'll be difficult, but I'm trusting you to defuse the situation.
They're blind if they don't.
What more could they want?
Don't worry. Accusations from outsiders are one thing; testimony from Voss civilians is quite another.
Find the Voss, no problem.
Diplomacy won't seem so bad when I'm through.
They'll definitely notice me.
If any Voss are injured as a result of your actions, we lose everything.
I'd like to talk to the failed Mystics myself. Comm me as soon as it's safe.
I've been waiting for you. Malcom Terrax is on a transport bound for Coruscant.
His price was steep, but worth it. There's no way Lord Beldiss can talk his way out of this.
Terrax was in Voss-Ka to identify failed Mystics. Lord Beldiss is offering them an alternative--joining the Sith.
What is Lord Beldiss planning?
That's a new approach.
You either have visions, or you don't.
How can a Mystic fail?
Mystics are tested before the Voss look to them for guidance. Failed Mystics pass the tests, but never have a vision.
Rejects won't get Lord Beldiss anywhere.
Good riddance to them.
He wants them because they're vulnerable. Failed Mystics have no place in Voss society.
Terrax knows Lord Beldiss's plans. We need him alive.
The comm logs don't implicate Lord Beldiss directly, but they prove he has Imperial spies in Voss-Ka. One of them is Malcom Terrax.
Terrax is one of Imperial Intelligence's best agents--but now he'll be executed. We can't let that happen.
You think an Imperial spy will help us?
Because he might know more?
Executed? Is that a fact?
Standard Imperial procedure--now that his operation has been exposed.
I'm happy to let it happen.
Letting one spy get killed out of spite isn't going to win this war, or the Voss.
If we save Terrax, he might talk.
The SIS spotted a new Dusk Squadron camp nearby. They're Imperial assassins, and their location is perfect for a quiet execution. I'm willing to bet they're here for Terrax.
I'll protect him as if he were one of ours.
He deserves a rescue, then.
Let's just hope he appreciates it.
Terrax could refuse to follow a Jedi.
What if he won't help us?
If he makes that mistake, he'll find out fast enough.
If Terrax wants to live, I'll make sure he does.
I'll do my best, considering.
If he goads you, ignore him. Lord Beldiss would blame his death on us.
Sure this won't come back to bite us?
Will this cause more trouble?
Let me worry about Lord Beldiss. At least for now.
Get Terrax out, got it.
I can't believe I'm rescuing an Imperial.
You're really killing me here.
I have to smile and play nice with a Sith Lord. I completely understand.
I'll make the arrangements for a deal with Terrax. I just hope he's still alive.
Spin this all you like, Ambassador. You tampered with Voss communication towers.
Is that a fact, Lord Beldiss? I suppose I forged the Imperial comm logs that came out of them, too.
Stop. Neither were present. Both are blind.
Those involved will answer. Did you strike against Voss?
My goal was to protect the Voss from the Empire.
That wasn't my intention.
Your protection is destructive.
I was acting on behalf of the Voss.
Quite the opposite, in fact.
The Voss were unaware.
My objective was to retrieve the comm logs. The Empire resisted.
It was self-defense only.
None survived to object.
No, sir. The Empire beat me to it.
Hey, don't look at me.
Interesting words.
I exposed Imperial spies!
You deserve none.
What a stupid question.
The truth stays hidden.
The towers were abandoned. No Voss were harmed. This will not happen again.
I can personally guarantee that, Laryn-Ki.
You against the Empire, and me against Lord Beldiss. I'm not sure which fight was harder.
How can Laryn-Ki ignore the Empire's crimes?
You should have won.
He's been fed lies and false promises by every outsider he's met. I don't blame him for wanting undeniable proof.
What happens now?
What happens now?
Definitely not mine.
I'd trade jobs with you, if I wasn't sure we'd both die quickly.
Lord Beldiss is plotting something. Those comm logs will tell us where to start.
These accusations are ridiculous. The Republic has only tried to protect the galaxy from the Empire.
The Empire offers more power and protection than the Republic ever could, minus the rigid codes of morality.
The Empire forgets. The Voss protect themselves.
Let us pause here. I believe the ambassador has some introductions to make.
Lord Beldiss, speaking on behalf of the Empire. Laryn-Ki, envoy to the Three.
Your culture is new to me. Who are the Three?
Can you explain that title?
Are the Three related to the Mystics?
Can you explain that title?
I'm not familiar with the chain of command around here.
Can you explain that title?
That's very impressive. Whatever it means.
Envoy to the what now?
The Three govern. The Mystics see. The Three decide.
The Three state outsiders are only curiosity.
I'm happy to be here.
Ambassador Jannik asked for this meeting.
One might even say he was desperate for it.
We're speaking to a Sith?
Forgive them, Laryn-Ki. It must be difficult to face an enemy who's so often crushed you.
That's the difference between the Republic and the Empire. We can be civil.
Clearly.
I'd like to show the Voss something different. An example of everything the Republic stands for.
Really? A band of fugitives wanted for their crimes against the Empire?
If the Empire attacks, we defend ourselves.
We do what we have to.
Don't forget, Laryn-Ki--the Jedi Order views your Mystics as tainted.
The order doesn't speak for me.
Their views aren't mine.
The Mystics are truth. Opinion does not matter.
Sometimes we fear what we don't understand.
It's a natural reaction.
You may never understand.
Soldiers have blind loyalty to their cause. Your mindless Republic grunts are no different.
The Empire started this war. I fight because I have to.
Just doing my job, sir.
A criminal guilty of smuggling illegal goods across the galaxy? You can't be serious.
I should be more discreet.
Heard about that, huh?
There is no need. Criminals do not exist on Voss.
This is your example? The person responsible for attacking Moff Kilran in defense of a known fugitive?
I had no other choice.
If necessary.
You're wrong, my lord.
Outsiders lie.
That's bantha fodder.
Enough.
Offworld conflicts mean nothing.
The Voss look forward. Outsiders look back. I will say no more.
An excellent example, Ambassador. Weak and hopeless, like you.
The more Lord Beldiss talks, the worse the Republic looks. We have to show the Voss what Sith like him are really after.
Diplomacy isn't usually the Sith's style.
He'll show his true colors.
The Empire already tried to conquer Voss. The Voss annihilated them like they'd been prepared for years. Diplomacy's their only option.
How do we do that?
Get rid of Lord Beldiss. Problem solved.
Just eliminate him, I say.
We're better than that. I can expose him. I just need proof.
We know Lord Beldiss has spies in Voss-Ka. Our scouts think he's using some defunct Voss comm towers to communicate with them.
The comm logs could prove Lord Beldiss has designs against the Voss. I need someone to make it past the Empire's defenses.
Isn't a firefight worse than spying on someone?
Won't that upset the Voss?
If it doesn't disturb the peace or threaten the Voss, they don't concern themselves with it.
Shouldn't be an issue.
I'll do far worse than that.
Please, act only in self-defense. Lord Beldiss doesn't need any more ammunition.
Get those comm logs quick as you can. I'll be waiting.
Change your mind? You've got perfect timing--the Empire's representative is in rare form today.
Remember, be respectful. We need this alliance, and the Empire's made us look bad enough already. I'll reconnect them now.
Don't engage the Empire. I've got enough on my plate already.
I'll try, I guess.
